name: Ike

topics.response_text: {Player not in NCR gear}{pleased}A customer! Not many people come into Boulder City these days.

topics.topic_text: Where does the concrete come from?
topics.response_text: {Quarry Junction Deathclaws dead}Most of the limestone comes from Quarry Junction out west. The supply had stopped for awhile because of a Deathclaw problem.

topics.topic_text: I'm not a trooper. I just happen to be wearing the armor.
topics.response_text: Oh. Well, you'd better not let any of the real troopers hear that - and, of course, they won't be hearing it from me, neither.

topics.topic_text: Show me what you have for sale.
Why is the Big Horn off limits to troopers?
topics.response_text: The workers here don't much like the military. After too many fights and broken noses, the NCR doesn't allow troops to spend time here.
Most of the town is rubble - destroyed during the Battle of Hoover Dam - and the only other thing around here is the concrete mixing yard.
The NCR has been constructing bunkers up and down the river. From what I've heard, it's a little late for that.

description:
Ike is a 55 year-old Caucasian Male.

Ike is the weathered proprietor of the Big Horn Saloon, the last remaining establishment in the once-thriving Boulder City. With a face etched by lines of hardship and a perpetually weary demeanor, he has become a fixture in the Mojave Wasteland. His saloon, though sparse, offers a respite from the harsh desert environment, serving watered-down Nuka-Cola and whatever alcohol he can scavenge or trade for.

Ike's Personality: Resilient and stubborn, Ike has seen better days but refuses to give up on his establishment. He's a pragmatic survivor who values stability and routine, though he harbors a quiet cynicism about the future. Despite the hardships, he maintains a sense of hospitality and will listen to the stories of travelers who pass through his doors.

Ike's Backstory: Ike was born and raised in Boulder City, a small settlement near the Colorado River. Before the First Battle of Hoover Dam in 2277, he worked as a miner in the nearby hills, but the battle devastated his home and community. Many residents fled or perished, but Ike chose to stay, inheriting the Big Horn Saloon from its previous owner. Over the years, he's watched as Boulder City continued to decline, its population dwindling to just himself. He's become a repository of local knowledge, remembering the town's heyday and the events that led to its current state.
